byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi and Danielle Ivory contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Japanese auto supplier Takata, in fourth appearance before Congress, faces strong skepticism and criticism regarding its recall and replacement of faulty airbags in some 34 million vehicles; hearing is punctuated by announcement that Fiat Chrysler will no longer use Takata airbags in replacements, citing concerns about propellant; lawmakers also reserve criticism for National Highway Traffic Safety Admin.
lead_paragraph: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has been under scrutiny after extensive recalls of faulty Takata airbags and G.M. switches.

headline.main: Lawmakers Spread Anger in Recalls Over Airbags
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Spread Anger in Recalls Over Airbags

snippet: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has been under scrutiny after extensive recalls of faulty Takata airbags and G.M. switches.

keywords.value: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
keywords.name: organizations
